Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE; POLISHED
Name: Pitcher
Description: A pitcher with a narrow mouth, moulded with a pouring spout, a clearly marked neck, a globular body which is somewhat pointed at the bottom and an unstable base. The beginning of a vertical handle is preserved. Paste of a pink colour. The exterior surface is covered with a polished orangey coating which is partially lost.
